divs: sighting detailsbefore i tell about the star-like objects, i have to go back to the report i filed with mufon that happened on 7\13\11 when i sighted a 250'-500' triangle while eastbound on i-10 at mm345. read this report first because on this same night after seeing my first ufo my eyes where searching the night sky as i continued driving toward san antonio, tx. keep in mind that i leave ft. stockton between 8-10 pm and arrive san antonio 1-3 am. at about mm485 just east of kerrville i noticed a large star (4-5 times larger than normal) at a low altitude, about 5-10 degrees above the horizon. sometimes the hills and trees would block my view of it. i kept sight of it all the way into san antonio after i had taken the i-410e loop and continued north on i-35. at this point it was at a 45 degree angle up and about 15 degrees to the east of the interstate. then i exit at mm175. i continued to see this same sequence daily (monday-friday) for about 4-6 weeks. then i started noticing the star farther west, earlier in the evening. in mid september i saw it from the ft. stockton yard (mm259) at 8 pm. i had always watched it closely and i couldn't really see if it was moving, sometimes i thought it was, but being in a big truck bouncing around i was never sure, even though i had stopped on occasion and watched it for a few minutes. i continued to see this star almost every night (m-f) in different locations. it would be below the high clouds but the low clouds would block my view of it. on november 23, 2011, at 10:25 pm i stopped at mm361 near ozona, tx to watch this star that was a little south of ozona, as i watched it did a little dance and then moved up and down, i really was not sure if i saw the dance or if it was in my head but i knew that i saw it move up and down. it appeared to be about 2-5 miles away and i kept sight of it at a 20 degree angle all the way into san antonio mm550. i'm on my return trip home, same night, november 24 now, and i see this star object at i-10 mm545, it's just a little south of the interstate and i keep sight of it off and on through kerrville mm508, at 4:25am i stop at a parking area mm498 and watch this thing for a couple of minutes and i'll be damned if it didn't do another little dance in the sky and then start moving west. i jumped in the truck and continued west on i-10 and kept sight of it until mm488 when it disappeared over the horizon. i was traveling at 65 mph and estimate it was traveling about 150 mph. i won't go into detail about all of the sightings, but i have seen them move up and down, left and right often. i've seen them turn off their lights at dawn as they speed up heading west. it seems that they travel east later evening and travel west early morning, but this does not hold true to all sightings. lately i've been seeing 2-3 objects over ft. stockton about 7-9pm, often i see one just south of ozona about 9-11pm, i don't see much over sonora. just after christmas 2011 i saw 3 objects se of junction at about 6am, and lately they have been over sw san antonio on a regular basis. since christmas i have seen an increase. on 12\28 i saw 5 star-like objects on my way to san antonio and on 12\29 i saw 9 on my to sa. i looked at one with low power binoculars and i could see the constant glowing\pulsing white light and a small red flashing light off one side with a little bit of a blue\green light. i have pointed these out to some of the other drivers but they seem not to care or don't want to know.
trends: There have been no other sightings in Kerville
This sighting has never been favorited.
Object Flight Path: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path then hovering
Summary: Increase in low altitude star-like objects that pulsate, hover, travel and dance.
